data.question: What is the main application of the ultramicroporous cobalt gallate metal–organic framework (Co-gallate) discussed?
data.answer: Highly selective sieving separation of propylene from propane at ambient conditions.

data.question: What property of Co-gallate allows for the selective separation of propylene from propane?
data.answer: Optimal pore structure for the exact confinement of propylene molecules while excluding the slightly larger propane molecules.

data.question: Is Co-gallate stable under different environments?
What is the dynamic separation productivity of Co-gallate for propylene under ambient conditions?
Does Co-gallate exhibit high water stability?
What method is used to synthesize Co-gallate?
data.answer: Hydrothermal reaction of gallic acid and cobalt chloride in aqueous solution.

data.question: Can Co-gallate efficiently separate propylene from a mixture containing methane and ethane?
What is the purity of propylene obtained through a single pressure swing adsorption (PSA) process using Co-gallate?
What is the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) for propylene in Co-gallate?
Is the adsorption capacity of Co-gallate for propylene higher than that for propane?
What is the IAST selectivity of Co-gallate for propylene over propane at 1 bar and 298 K?
Does Co-gallate require high desorption temperatures for regeneration?
What is the main advantage of using Co-gallate for propylene/propane separation over traditional methods?
data.answer: Energy-efficient separation due to its high sieving selectivity and stability under different environments.

data.question: What is the role of the elliptical pore window in Co-gallate for gas separation?
data.answer: It enables size exclusion of propane while allowing propylene to be adsorbed.

data.question: Is the synthesis of Co-gallate considered green and cost-effective?
What is the boiling point difference between propylene and propane?
Can Co-gallate be reused for multiple separation cycles without loss of performance?
What is the main challenge in separating propylene from propane?
data.answer: The small difference in molecular size and structure between propylene and propane makes their separation difficult.

data.question: Does Co-gallate have a higher propylene adsorption capacity compared to other metal-organic frameworks?
What is the significance of the pore size distribution in Co-gallate for gas separation?
data.answer: The pore size distribution is crucial for achieving selective adsorption of propylene over propane by size exclusion.
